alert.note: Alert for Ozark (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 23 at 11:16PM CDT until March 24 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in south central Missouri, Howell. In southwest Missouri, Christian, Douglas, Ozark and Taney. * WHEN...Until 515 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1116 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... North Fork River at County Road 278, Bryant Creek at Highway 95, Spring Creek at County Road 142, Little Beaver Creek at Old Cheese Plant Road, South Spring Creek at County Road 408, Little North Fork River at County Road 916 and Bear Creek at Reno Springs Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Branson, Forsyth, Merriam Woods, Rockaway Beach, Taneyville, Kissee Mills, Bull Creek, Wasola, Thornfield, Squires, Rome, Noble, Brownbranch, Bradleyville, Rockbridge, Brixey, Gentryville, Powersite, Ozark Beach, Edgewater Beach, Dora, Walnut Shade, Lake Taneycomo, Bryant Creek State Park and Shepherd of the Hills State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
